H0.text: In the Bible's New Testament what was the last battle between good and evil before the day of judgement. Megiddo

H1.text: In the Bible's New Testament what was the last battle between good and evil before the day of judgement. Gog and Magog

H2.text: In the Bible's New Testament what was the last battle between good and evil before the day of judgement. The Valley of Jehoshaphat

H3.text: In the Bible's New Testament what was the last battle between good and evil before the day of judgement. Armagedon

A4.text: Armageddon is the prophesied gathering of armies for a battle during the end times, according to the Book of Revelation in the New Testament of the Christian Bible.

A5.text: The extent of this great movement in which God deals with 'the kings of the earth and of the whole world' will not be seen unless it is realized that the 'battle of that great day of God Almighty' is not an isolated battle, but rather a campaign that extends over the last half of the tribulation period.

A6.text: When the thousand years are over, Satan will be released from his prison and will go out to deceive the nations in the four corners of the Earth—Gog and Magog—and to gather them for battle.

A7.text: In the New Testament's Revelation 20, Jewish-Christian tradition had come to view Ezekiel's 'Gog from Magog' as 'Gog and Magog'.
